body: Are you sure you are connecting to PowerShell Core endpoint (not Windows PowerShell endpoint)?

Yes, from sshd_config
`Subsystem	powershell	c:/PowerShell/6-preview/pwsh.exe -sshs -NoLogo -NoProfile`

And to verify.
```
C:\Users\tdaniely> Enter-PSSession -HostName 10.*.*.* -UserName Administrator
[Administrator@10.*.*.*]: PS C:\Users\Administrator\Documents> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.0-preview.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.0-preview.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

Note, I could easily reproduce this on my home PC.

```
PS C:\Users\user\Desktop> $s = New-PSSession -HostName localhost -UserName user
PS C:\Users\user\Desktop> $s

 Id Name            Transport ComputerName    ComputerType    State         ConfigurationName     Availability
 -- ----            --------- ------------    ------------    -----         -----------------     ------------
  2 Runspace1       SSH       localhost       RemoteMachine   Opened        DefaultShell             Available


PS C:\Users\user\Desktop> Copy-Item '.\file.doc' "C:\test.doc" -ToSession $s
Copy-Item : Cannot process argument transformation on parameter 'Encoding'. 'Byte' is not a supported encoding name. For information on defining a custom encoding, see the documentation for the Encoding.RegisterProvider method.
Parameter name: name
At line:1 char:1
+ Copy-Item '.\file.doc' "C:\test.doc" -ToSession ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Write-Error], ParameterBindin...mationException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Management.Automation.ParameterBindingArgumentTransformationException,PSCopyFileAlternateStreamToRemoteSession

Copy-Item : Failed to copy file C:\Users\user\Desktop\file.doc to remote target destination.
At line:1 char:1
+ Copy-Item '.\file.doc' "C:\test.doc" -ToSession ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : WriteError: (C:\Users\user\...file.doc:String) [Copy-Item], IOException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : CopyError,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.CopyItemCommand

PS C:\Users\user\Desktop> ls C:\test.doc


    Directory: C:\


Mode                LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                -------------         ------ ----
-a----        12/21/2018     0:19          38912 test.doc
```
@JamesWTruher Could you please comment the issue?

I'm hitting this on a GitHub Build machine in my CI pipeline in my GitHub repo: Set-Content : Cannot process argument transformation on parameter 'Encoding'. 'Byte' is not a supported encoding name. For information on defining a custom encoding, see the documentation for the Encoding.RegisterProvider method. You can see it in the "Decode the .pfx" step. https://github.com/edwardskrod/devops-for-windows-apps/pull/11/checks?check_run_id=355565392 This works fine on my dev box. Can anyone help me get this working? $pfx_cert = Get-Content '.\EdwardSkrodDeveloper_password.pfx' -Encoding Byte $base64 = [System.Convert]::ToBase64String($pfx_cert) $pfx_cert_byte = [System.Convert]::FromBase64String($base64) Set-Content -Path '.\SigningCertificate.pfx' -Value "$pfx_cert_byte" -Encoding Byte The idea is that I want to encode my signing certificate so that I can store it in in GitHub Secrets. Then I want to decode it back to the original .pfx. On my dev machine, setting -Encoding to Byte works great. But it doesn't work on the GitHub machine.
GitHub
Address feedback by edwardskrod · Pull Request #11 · edwardskrod/devops-for-windows-apps
Address feedback from MVPs Remove .pfx from repo Removed .pfx from repo Encode .pfx in Base64 and add to GitHub secrets Decode .pfx in CI/CD pipelines Create distribution path for store In C...
@edwardskrod In PowerShell Core you should use -AsByteStream instead of -Encoding Byte.

Seems yet unsolved..

# Steps to reproduce

## Environment

### Source host

Hostname: src-host

OS: Microsoft Windows Server 2019 Standard

Powershell:
```
$PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

### Target host

Hostname: tgt-host

OS: Microsoft Windows Server 2019 Standard

Powershell:
```
$PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

## Commands

```
PS tgt-host> $session = New-PSSession -HostName "src-host" -UserName "administrator"
PS tgt-host> ..enter password..
PS tgt-host> $session

 Id Name            Transport ComputerName    ComputerType    State         ConfigurationName     Availability
 -- ----            --------- ------------    ------------    -----         -----------------     ------------
  2 Runspace1       SSH       src-host        RemoteMachine   Opened        DefaultShell             Available

PS tgt-host> Copy-Item -Path "C:\src\some-performance-counter-log.blg" -Destination "C:\tgt\" -FromSession $session
```

## Expected

*.blg file copied successfully from src-host to tgt-host.

## Actual

Exception thrown:
```
Copy-Item: 'Byte' is not a supported encoding name. For information on defining a custom encoding, see the documentation for the Encoding.RegisterProvider method. (Parameter 'name')
```

I've tried this with different variants of `Copy-Item` in terms of `-Path` being a file, folder or folder content. The same error always occurs.

Also tried other binary files: same error.

It works fine with text based files using the exact same environment and command sequence.

Using a WinRM PSSession (`New-PSSession -ComputerName ".."`) instead of an SSH PSSession produces the same result.

Any advice on how to get this working? Also, what is the plan here? It's been reported in 2018 under PS 6..

Does anyone copy?

I don't think it's too much to ask that someone from the Powershell team leaves a quick comment or tells me what I'm not seeing.

This bug already cost me hours and a fix or workaround from this discussion is not apparent to me. Further, as I'm not a Powershell Guru, I don't know that or how `Copy-Item` uses `Get-Content` under the hood and what I should take from @edwardskrod post.
